intro: Lasianthus rhinocerotis subsp. xishuangbannaensis, commonly known as the Xishuangbanna lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. It is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage. Its subspecific classification highlights its distinct ecological and morphological traits compared to other members of the species.
